protocol_name: Script R10: Whole Metagenome Beta Diversity
protocol_name_html: Script R10: Whole Metagenome Beta Diversity
description:
This protocol outlines the beta-diversity analysis that we performed on the whole metagenome samples. We measured the signifiance of the dissimilarity between samples that were grouped by biological occlusion status, microenvironment (sebaceous, moist, etc), and sampling time point. Here we also describe our intrapersonal vs interpersonal dissimilarity measurements. Based on methods from the following publication:

Hannigan, Geoffrey D., et al. "The Human Skin Double-Stranded DNA Virome: Topographical and Temporal Diversity, Genetic Enrichment, and Dynamic Associations with the Host Microbiome." mBio 6.5 (2015): e01578-15.
protocol_affiliation: DEPARTMENT OF DERMATOLOGY UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA

components.data: Because there were many samples, and especially many OTUs, it took substantial computing power to get the distance matrix from the data set. We saved an R image of the environment that contained the distance matrix and stats. Because the R session image provides quick access to the data, we load that here for the notebook. The actual matrix can be found in the intermediate files.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Because there were many samples, and especially many OTUs, it took substantial computing power to get the distance matrix from the data set. We saved an R image of the environment that contained the distance matrix and stats. Because the R session image provides quick access to the data, we load that here for the notebook. The actual matrix can be found in the intermediate files.

components.data: We will want to format the data for visualization, and then use NMDS ordination to visualize the clusters formed by our categories of interest. Generate subset of mapping file for only the specific anatomic sites and all time points (2 and 3).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We will want to format the data for visualization, and then use NMDS ordination to visualize the clusters formed by our categories of interest. Generate subset of mapping file for only the specific anatomic sites and all time points (2 and 3).

source_data.name:
SUBSET_MAP <- INPUT_MAP[-which(INPUT_MAP$NexteraXT_SampleID %in% NA), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[which(SUBSET_MAP$TimePoint %in% c(2,3)), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[-which(SUBSET_MAP$Site_Symbol %in% c("Ba","Ph","Vf","Neg")), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[-which(SUBSET_MAP$SubjectID %in% c(2,3,9,11)), ]
SUBSET_MAP <- SUBSET_MAP[c(order(SUBSET_MAP$NexteraXT_SampleID)),]

components.data: Get only the samples described in the map subset.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get only the samples described in the map subset.

source_data.name:
KEEP_SAMPLES <- as.vector(SUBSET_MAP$NexteraXT_SampleID)
INPUT_SUBSET <- INPUT_NO_FINAL[which(INPUT_NO_FINAL$ContigID %in% c(KEEP_SAMPLES)), ]
row.names(INPUT_SUBSET) <- INPUT_SUBSET[,1]
INPUT_SUB_FORMAT <- INPUT_SUBSET[,-1]

components.data: Visualize the distance matrix using NMDS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Visualize the distance matrix using NMDS.

source_data.name:
BRAY_ORD_NMDS <- metaMDS(INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX,k=3)

BRAY_ORD_FIT = data.frame(MDS1 = BRAY_ORD_NMDS$points[,1], MDS2 = BRAY_ORD_NMDS$points[,2], MDS3 = BRAY_ORD_NMDS$points[,3])
BRAY_ORD_NMDS_STRESS <- BRAY_ORD_NMDS$stress
BRAY_ORD_FIT$SampleID <- rownames(BRAY_ORD_FIT)
NMDS_AND_MAP <- merge(BRAY_ORD_FIT, SUBSET_MAP, by.x="SampleID", by.y="NexteraXT_SampleID")

components.data: Now we will visualize the data as 3D scatter plots.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Now we will visualize the data as 3D scatter plots.

components.data: Plot site microenvironment.
components.name: Description

source_data.name:
s3d<-scatterplot3d(NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS1,NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS2,NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS3, pch=16, color=as.integer(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories), type="h", main="metaMDS Ordination: Healthy Skin Metagenome Time Point 2 and 3")
legend('right', pch = 16,legend = levels(factor(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories)),  col = seq_along(levels(NMDS_AND_MAP$Site_Categories)), inset=c(0.1,0))

adonis(INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX ~ SUBSET_MAP$Site_Categories, perm = 999, strata = SUBSET_MAP$SubjectID)

components.name: Expected result

components.name: Description

source_data.name:
s3d<-scatterplot3d(NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS1,NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS2,NMDS_AND_MAP$MDS3, pch=16, color=as.integer(NMDS_AND_MAP$TimePoint), type="h", main="TimePoint1 Vs TimePoint2 Bray Curtis")
legend('right', pch = 16, legend = levels(NMDS_AND_MAP$TimePoint), col = seq_along(levels(NMDS_AND_MAP$TimePoint)),inset=c(0.1,0))

adonis(INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX ~ SUBSET_MAP$TimePoint, perm = 999, strata = SUBSET_MAP$SubjectID)

legend('right', pch = 16, legend = levels(NMDS_AND_MAP$Occlusion), col = seq_along(levels(NMDS_AND_MAP$Occlusion)),inset=c(0.1,0))

adonis(INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX ~ SUBSET_MAP$Occlusion, perm = 999, strata = SUBSET_MAP$SubjectID)

components.name: Expected result

components.data: Get intra-personal and interpersonal distance similarities, showing intra over time is more similar than that site compared to all other sites. INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX was generated using the vegan command, vegdist (INPUT_SUB_FORMAT, method = "bray").
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get intra-personal and interpersonal distance similarities, showing intra over time is more similar than that site compared to all other sites. INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX was generated using the vegan command, vegdist (INPUT_SUB_FORMAT, method = "bray").

source_data.name: INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX_MATRIX <- data.frame(as.matrix(INPUT_SUBSET_DIST_MATRIX))
source_data.description: It is loaded from the RData image to save computational time

components.name: Expected result

components.data: Get intrapersonal values in same format.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Get intrapersonal values in same format.

source_data.name:
INTER_TP3_MELT$Type <- "Inter"
INTRA_TRANS <- data.frame(t(INTRAPERSONAL_DIST))
INTRA_TRANS_CUT <- INTRA_TRANS[,c("X1","X4")]
INTRA_TRANS_CUT$Type <- "Intra"
colnames(INTRA_TRANS_CUT) <- c("variable","value","Type")
INTRA_TRANS_CUT$value <- as.numeric(as.character(INTRA_TRANS_CUT$value))
row.names(INTRA_TRANS_CUT) <- NULL

components.data: Bind together all of these data frames.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Bind together all of these data frames.

source_data.name:
BOUND_DIST <- rbind(INTRA_TRANS_CUT, INTER_TP2_MELT, INTER_TP3_MELT)
BOUND_DIST <- BOUND_DIST[,c(2,3)]

components.data: Plot the resulting distances as means with stdev.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Plot the resulting distances as means with stdev.

source_data.name: BOUND_SUMMARY <- ddply(BOUND_DIST, c("Type"), summarise, N=length(value), mean=mean(value), sd=sd(value), se=sd/sqrt(N))

components.data: Now we can visualize our results.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Now we can visualize our results.

source_data.name: ggplot(BOUND_SUMMARY, aes(x=Type, y=mean)) + theme_bw() + geom_bar(position=position_dodge(), stat="identity", fill="lightblue") + geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=mean-se, ymax=mean+se), width=.2, position=position_dodge(.9))

components.name: Expected result

components.data: Run a T-test to calculate the statistical significance of the differences in means.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run a T-test to calculate the statistical significance of the differences in means.
